Title: Data Center Facilities Manager - Singapore
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Engineering & Operations Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. The role: Data Center Facilities Manager - Singapore The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facility Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non-critical electrical or mechanical system components). You'll provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order. You will develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures. Additional Role Description: As a Data Center Facilities Manager, you will lead a large team who are responsible for 24/7 data center operations. You will be responsible for meeting service level agreements with internal teams regarding uptime, efficiencies, and cost. In addition, you will work to grow the team in order to meet the needs of the business, while also leveraging technical talent and identifying key hiring needs for regional data centers. Responsibilities: - Provide technical input in the planning, design, and development of all electrical and mechanical facilities equipment. - Ensure that facilities issues are identified and repaired quickly. - Mentor and develop the skills of an internal team in order to scale in support of facilities equipment. - Work towards continual improvement in operation and maintenance efficiencies and travel to other regions to facilitate projects. - Lead a team of skilled electrical and mechanical technicians.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Mechanical/Marine/Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience. - 6 years of experience in the management of teams performing installation, maintenance, or upgrade work in data center or business-critical facilities. Preferred qualifications: - 6 years of relevant work experience, including experience in planning, creating, and implementing complex control system designs for large data center installations, including overseeing negotiations or technical interactions with equipment providers. - Experience as a Chief Engineer or Facilities Manager of Critical Facilities/Data Centers. - Experience in electrical and mechanical systems and cooling principles. Specialized experience with generators, power electronics, chillers, and pumps. - Experience in motivating, leading, and creating an effective team environment.

Title: Data Processing Executive
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesData processors spend the majority of their day inputting various company data into computers. This data can originate on paper forms, such as invoices, or it could be electronic, such as email. The data processor first checks the data contained in the form to make sure it's complete and that required information isn't missing. She then enters this data into a system. This can take the form of a text document such as Microsoft Word, a database system like Microsoft Access, an online web management system such as Salesforce, or propriety software specifically written for the organization.
Requirements: RequirementsMost companies will not require any formal education for Data Entry roles. However, there are skills that are expected in order to perform this role efficiently, and these competencies should be part of a Data Entry job description:  Computer literacy and familiarity with various computer programs such as MS Office (formal computer training may be advantageous in progressing in this career) Attention to detail Knowledge of grammar and punctuation Ability to work to time constraints Able to use software to produce report

Title: Data Product Manager

Company: CAMBRIDGE CENTRE FOR ADVANCED RESEARCH AND EDUCATION IN SINGAPORE LTD.
Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWho are we? We are the University of Cambridge presence in Singapore called Cambridge CARES, sponsored by the NRF CREATE program CAM.CREATE. CARES also hosts industry-funded and other agencies funded projects. Our team is comprised of world-class scientists and engineers working in a vibrant, fast-paced environment with great opportunities for knowledge and skills development. CARES is a partner in the Pharma Innovation Programme Singapore (PIPS). The core partners of PIPS are: the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*Star), The National University of Singapore (NUS), the Nanyang Technological University (NTU), the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), and pharma companies GlaxoSmithKline (GSK), MSD International GmbH (Singapore branch), and Pfizer Asia Pacific. Within PIPS, CARES is leading a project “DEVELOPMENT OF MULTI-STEP PROCESSES IN PHARMA”, which aims to transform the way how manufacturing processes are developed within the context of pharma. The project will include research developments in the areas of process systems engineering, machine learning and automated experimental systems. The outcomes of the project are expected to be directly transferred to the industrial partners.   Who are we looking for? We are looking to fill a vacancy of a Research Fellow with experience in process development and machine learning. We are seeking a candidate with experience in closed-loop optimization using machine learning algorithms, understanding of coding and development of machine learning tools, the experience of using machine learning toolboxes.
Requirements: RequirementsWhat skills do you have? Working with machine learning toolboxes in Matlab and/or Python, developing machine learning applications for chemical process development, working with experimentalists on automated process development.   When is position available and for how long? The position is available from June 1st 2019 as a fixed-term contract with the end-date of 31 May 2022. The position will be offered subject to a probationary period of six months. What can we offer you?  A stimulating working-environment with friendly, highly motivated colleagues. Opportunities to develop and implement new ideas in a creative environment. A competitive salary in line with your skills and experience. A one-year contract in the first instance, extendable following satisfactory performance. A comprehensive medical insurance cover as part of your employment.    Please note that this post is mainly based in the CREATE Tower at NUS University Town, Singapore. To apply, please send your CV and cover letter (summarising the most relevant skills and experience that you have for the position)

Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering (ChBE) at the National University of Singapore (NUS) has a highly versatile engineering program. The Smart Systems Engineering (SSE) research group led by Assistant Professor Xiaonan Wang has a broad interest and unique interdisciplinary focus on multi-scale systems research and the state-of-the-art computational methods including machine learning/deep learning, general artificial intelligence (AI), Internet-of-Things (IoT) and blockchain technologies. We aim to combining theories, models, and real-world practice in many fundamental domains (e.g., renewable energy, functional materials, healthcare manufacturing and supply chain etc.) through intelligent algorithms/tools development and applications.   We seek to appoint 1-2 talented individuals to join our team at NUS as a Research Fellow to work on several collaborative projects with other world-leading institutes (e.g., MIT, Imperial College London and Tsinghua University).   Key Responsibilities:  Lead either the advanced manufacturing module (especially cyber-physical systems) or the smart energy module (and broadly energy, water, waste and other resources) to develop quantitative and AI methods for system analysis and optimization; Deploy advanced data mining, machine learning and other computational strategies to identify key driven-factors for accelerated technological development; Work closely with our experimental and industrial collaborators to apply state-of-the-art technologies in the computing platform.
Requirements: Requirements Applicants should have a PhD degree in Engineering, Environmental Science, Chemistry, Computing or related disciplines. The positions require highly motivated individuals who have strong interest in advanced computational methods applied to frontier research. The researchers should have initiatives to work on exciting multi-disciplinary cases with real-world implications.

Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSoft robotics is a growing, new field that focuses on these mechanical qualities and on the integration of materials, structures, and software. In the same way that animal movements are based on the tight integration of skin for protection and sensing, soft robotics aims to achieve better and simpler mechanisms by exploiting the ‘mechanical intelligence’ of soft materials. This job aims to develop intelligent soft robotics with 2D materials protective and sensory skin, and also to build a machine-learning model to enhance the analytic capability of robotics.   The intelligent soft robotics will feature  high mechanical stretchability, effective chemical and flame protection that allows the personnel and robotic to survive or work in a harsh environment, skin-like sensing capacities that can monitor the actuation of pneumatic robotic hands and their interaction with human/environment, and AI neural networks with advanced analytics capabilities.  The machine with sensors can enhance their environmental awareness and improve the robotic-human interaction, which will be effective in overcoming mobility limitations experienced with standard rigid tools.
Requirements: RequirementsA Ph.D. degree in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Material Science, Chemistry, or related fields. The ability to work independently, and adapt to new areas is required as the needs of the project evolve. The candidates with computational background (coding or simulation) will be highly preferred. Experience in 2D materials assembly, stretchable electronics, electrochemical characterizations, and soft robotics would be an advantage. The candidate should have excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as excellent interpersonal skills.   Applicants should email a cover letter and curriculum vitae to Asst. Prof. Po-Yen Chen (checp@nus.edu.sg). The CV should include educational and professional background, a list of publications/posters/conference presentations, and contact information of referees.

Title: Project Manager, Systems Integration (3-year contract), Centre for Teaching Excellence
Responsibilities: Roles & Responsibilities COMPANY DESCRIPTION  Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.  RESPONSIBILITIES  The EDGE: EdTech Greenhouse, under the ambit of SMU’s Centre for Teaching Excellence, is an exciting educational technology set-up which aims to translate high potential research projects (e.g. Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, learning analytics etc.) into minimum viable products for potential campus-wide distribution, bringing about the synthesis of design and development to enhance student learning outcomes. As part of the dynamic EDGE team, the Project Manager, Systems Integration, is required to identify and explore the complex technical and business issues involved in integrating custom software, hardware solutions, commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) software and business procedures and services. This would require the clear analysis of existing research prototypes and user requirements for translation to deployment to the university. The project manager’s role is to manage projects of increasing scale, complexity, and risk and to make sure that all of the components come together to ensure that the projects are completed on time and within budget. He/she will work closely with faculty researchers, software developers and the SMU’s Integrated Information Technology Services to understand user requirements, define and deliver new features, test new concepts, and assist with IT Systems integration and final implementation. Job Description  Explore product concepts to find and propose promising directions that address both human and business needs. Study existing system architecture and propose strategic decisions based on associated rationales about the overall structure, including the mapping of human interaction with these components. Gather data to analyse and specify the requirements of a system as part of the IT Systems Analysis and Design process. Supervise and support the coding and development process of software prototypes and minimum viable products. Collaborate closely with software developer(s) and researchers. Project management and support multiple projects simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines. Advise front-end engineers on User Interface (UI) implementation best practices.
Requirements: Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering. 3 to 5 years of professional experience in project management and application of project management methodologies. Experience in managing cross-functional projects. Ability to write codes to develop proof of concept/minimum viable product systems. Project Management Professional (PMP) is not required, but would be advantageous. Ability to build relationships with and influence other functional areas. Ability to apply Agile and Design Thinking/user-centric methodology to understand user requirements. Experience in the supervision of the coding and development of software prototypes. Knowledge in common database manipulation language, e.g. Structured Query Language (SQL) and applications programming. Experience in machine learning methods and algorithm would be advantageous. Strong interpersonal skills. Highly developed verbal and written communication skills. Experience in managing cross-functional projects. Organization and time management skills. Problem-solving skills with ability to perform root cause analysis. Ability to manage several concurrent projects. Knowledge of the development project lifecycle (e.g., design, development, testing, implementation, etc.) Extensive experience in meeting planning, facilitation, and presentation.  OTHER INFORMATION Candidates who do not possess the stipulated qualifications but have relevant work experience may still apply. Remuneration and appointment terms shall commensurate with qualifications and experience. SMU reserves the right to modify the appointment terms where necessary.

Title: Research Associate
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA Research Associate position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) http://www.eee.ntu.edu.sg is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and research. With more than 150 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,000 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world and ranks 6th in the field of Electrical & Electronic Engineering in the 2017 QS World University Rankings by Subjects. Job Description Recent studies have found that deep models can be easily fooled by adversarial examples, which poses a big challenge for those safety-critical applications like autonomous vehicles. The position is open for those who are interested in deep learning and computer vision. The successful candidate should be familiar with object detection or semantic segmentation algorithm which will be used as our attack and defensive objective. Then the candidate will be responsible for further research in the adversarial machine learning field to realize the attack and perturbation resistant techniques. The successful candidate is expected to contribute in the research comprises the following topics: (1) Enhance the attacks on open-source object detection model; (2) Evaluate and enhance defenses against adversarial examples; (3) Develop robustness evaluation and fooling recovery solutions on deep learning systems. Apart from working on technical aspects of research projects, the Research Associate will also take charge of general matters for the project, including data management and project documentation, writing project updates, and doing product demonstrations and presentations.
Requirements: Requirements Master in Engineering, preferably in control engineering, electrical engineering, computer science and technology, mechanical engineering, or information security; Good experience in machine learning and deep learning basics; Good knowledge in optimization (or Game theory), reinforcement learning is a plus.  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA Research Fellow position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. Established in 1981, the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering (EEE) is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research. To support teaching and cutting-edge research, EEE is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories, which are well-equipped with modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment. With about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,300 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world. The research staff will work on using machine learning approaches to tackle challenges in wireless communications, such as blind signals classification and detection, and channel parameter estimation in constrained channels, etc. Responsibilities:  Developing machine learning algorithm to solve problems in wireless communications, especially for blind receiver. Testing the developed algorithms by using raw data. Presenting work progress and publishing research findings. Work closely with PI, team members and collaborators to ensure timely and efficient completion of project milestones.
Requirements: RequirementsEducation background/ experience required:  PhD degree in Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Electrical Engineering.  Specific Knowledge & Skills:  Strong foundation in wireless communication algorithms and optimization techniques. Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning techniques and algorithms, and open-source machine learning frameworks such as Keras and Tensorflow, etc. Familiarity with C/Python/Matlab language. Good English reading and writing skills. Good communication skills and ability to work in a team.  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Cloud Operations Engineer
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Dathena Science Dathena is a Swiss and Singaporean company developing data governance software based on machine learning algorithms. Dathena is the most complete and accurate data governance platform and is the only solution to easily classify and manage data with this level of accuracy while helping companies to comply with regulations. Using cutting edge machine learning technology, Dathena sift through all unstructured data allowing to regain full control on company’s information. Job Purpose As a Cloud Operations Engineer, you will maintain reliable infrastructure so that our R&D and Product Teams can build solutions that solve our clients and partners' hardest problems and can be counted on when they are needed most. You will work collaboratively with Software and A.I. engineers to understand what they need to get their jobs done. You care deeply about the availability and security of our systems, and configuration as code is your tool for ensuring that everything is operating as it should. Core Responsability  Manage and secure Linux-based cloud systems and networks at scale. Work with tools to automate critical aspects of production systems such as: configuration management and deployment of infrastructure. Maintain the stability and performance of the cloud platform. Utilize the latest industry standard tools and practices to meet the evolving needs of our internal engineers/developers and external clients/partners.
Requirements: RequirementsTechnologies We Use  Languages: Python, Scala, and Java Systems Management: Terraform, Docker, Ansible, and Puppet Cloud Platforms: Azure, AWS and GCP Linux: CentOS (7)  What We Value  1-2 years experience in a similar role, or related technical field Coding/scripting fluency in at least one language and a commitment to automate solutions Experience with Linux systems from the kernel level and up Experience with configuration management solutions Ability to quickly take on new roles and responsibilities Track record of successfully deploying and running configuration management systems Desire to see features through from development to deployment in production environments

Title: Research Assistant (Artificial Intelligence)
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe National University of Singapore invites applications for the position of Research Assistant in the Department of Computer Science, School of Computing (SoC). SoC is strongly committed to research excellence in all its dimensions: Searching for fundamental results and insights, developing novel computational solutions to a wide range of applications, building large-scale experimental systems and improving the wellbeing of society. We seek to play an active role both internationally and locally in the core and emerging areas of Computer Science and Information Systems. The Research Assistant will be responsible for working closely with the Principal Investigator and lab members on one or more research projects. He/she should possess experience and interest in the following research areas:  Artificial Intelligence, machine learning Probabilistic models and inference algorithms Decision making under uncertainty, e.g., Markov decision process (MDP) and partially observable Markov decision process (POMDP)  Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.
Requirements: Requirements A Bachelor’s degree with Honours or a Master’s degree in the relevant area; and Experience in research.  Applicants with prior publications in the relevant area will be considered favourably.

Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe have a one-year Research Fellow position for the research work of microwave imaging using machine learning and holographic phase encryption.   Expect to develop algorithms for microwave imaging and apply machine learning to improve their performance.   Expect to combine wave physics with machine learning, rather than a “black-box” way of applying machine learning.   Expected to develop robust phase retrieval algorithms and apply them to holographic phase encryption.   Expected to study the sensitivity and complexity of security keys for the designed nanoscale security infrastructures.
Requirements: Requirements  Possess a PhD degree in electronic information science and technology or related fields, specializing in electromagnetics or acoustics.   Experienced in computational electromagnetics and inverse scattering problems. Proficient in microwave imaging techniques and signal processing techniques.   Experienced in numerical methods of electromagnetic scattering theory including method of moment, discrete dipole approximation, finite-element method, and boundary element method.   Having experience in basic machine learning.   Working experience of at least one year.   Extensive use of electromagnetic simulation software, such as GPR-MAX.   Open to fixed term contract.

Title: senior software engineer
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Isentia Isentia is the Asia-Pacific region's leading media intelligence company; we're a client-centric organization where you can really add value to our clients' businesses.   Our clients are diverse, ranging from globally renowned brands right through to start-ups and not for profit organisations.   We provide our team members with constructive feedback to foster their career growth, and you will have many opportunities to work with fun and talented people.  We also have an open and inclusive culture where we embrace opportunities to do better and we celebrate achievements wildly. We offer an opportunity to work with a great team of talented, innovative and passionate people across the Asia-Pacific and access to our innovative search technology, comprehensive coverage and expert research. We also offer a competitive salary and a heap of benefits!   Job description At Isentia, we are passionate about helping communicators understand media, data and content. This starts with our Tech team working with the latest cloud platforms and machine learning algorithms to collect data, analyse it and inform our customer on the issues important to them.   Our Software  Engineering team in Singapore is looking for Senior Software Engineers. Ideally, full-stack engineer (Nodejs/ Express or Python/ Flask, Angular 6 and Typescript). You have experience in developing APIs, micro services and integrating them with responsive Single Page Applications. To be successful in this role you will require a good experience in AWS, DevOps, CI/CD, and TDD. It‘s a really great time to join our software engineering team. We are agile and lean in our delivery approach. We run regular hackathon and blitz days. We stay ahead of the technology curve – Kubernetes, Apache Spark, Tensorflow you name it. This is an exceptional opportunity for someone who wants to really make a difference to our teams and clients by delivering solutions that truly meet the business needs and requirements.   Responsibilities:  working within an agile environment as part of a cross-functional collaborative team develop new products features involving front end as well as back end interactively and incrementally  implement integration with big data, natural language processing and machine learning services collaborating your team and product owner to perform task breakdown, estimation, and prioritization.  ensure that you are meeting our development standards and delivering high-quality software.
Requirements: Requirements You’re an experienced Senior Software Engineer/ Software Engineer with strong exposure in building high-throughput digital and data platforms. You have strong experience with at-least two of the following technologies: Nodejs and Express, Python and Flask, Angular 6 and Typescript. You have developed high-quality pixel perfect and highly aesthetic UI implementation to meet business needs and requirements You have a background in software engineering, strong experience with data structures and design patterns. You come from a cloud-native DevOps environment with a focus on highly available and scalable applications. You know how to build software with support for HA, scalability, fault tolerance and security. You are a team player with great communication skills who thrive working with people with diverse background.    If you worked as a Senior Software Engineer what would you have done last week?  Developed new APIs, microservices, and UI components and deployed multiple times in Production via our Continuous delivery process. Wrote automated unit tests, performance tests, and worked on various strategies to improve the quality of the software we deliver. Learned something new – for instance how to speed up your development workflow using Docker and Kubernetes or codify your build process. You mentored and coached junior software engineers in your squad; participated in various internal guilds and alliance meetings.    If you are interested in this role, then please send in your resume together with your salary expectation and notice period to Carrie.Lim@isentia.com now! We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Implement advanced strategies for gathering, reviewing and analyzing data requirements Convert client requirements into business logic  Conduct various requirements workshop to ensure smooth delivery Working with stakeholders at all levels as defined by the individuals project Assisting with integration and acceptance testing Providing support during and post implementation Ensure smooth communication with our client by acting as a ‘translator’ between business and IT Testing of APIs from external software providers
Requirements: Requirements Excellent interpersonal and communication skills – written and verbal  Experience working directly with customers   Experience working in a startup environment Experience with agile software delivery Experience with software-as-a-service and API-based business models   Understanding of microservice architecture Banking Experience in Wealth Management/ Group Technology and Operations preferred  Javascript or Python experience preferred

Title: Digital Marketing Manager - APJ
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Us Our ambitious goal of helping innovators build a better world with data started in 2009. Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, surpassing $1B in revenue at the end of 2017. The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pure’s technology literally in the driver’s seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power mission-critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation create a thriving company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love. For more information on our business, check out the corporate fact sheet here. Digital Marketing Team at Pure The Pure Storage Global Digital Marketing team is focused on supporting hyper growth, geographic expansion, and delivering world-class, dynamic, and intelligent online experiences that engage and delight our prospects, customers, partners, and employees globally. The team is focused on optimising every digital touchpoint and conversion trigger to grow revenue. We’re looking for a passionate digital marketing leader for our innovative Digital Marketing team. The team is responsible for global paid and organic search, paid media, social media marketing, purestorage.com and the digital analytics that ties it all together. The Digital Marketing team will also be responsible for capturing demand gen best practices and piloting innovation opportunities for marketing. This individual will be responsible for planning and optimising Pure’s paid digital media, demand generation, and the company’s social media programmes in APJ (Asia-Pacific and Japan). In this role, you will support our efforts to drive demand and multi-million-dollar pipeline through APJ paid media, social media, and web experiences optimised to accelerate conversions and drive incremental revenue. You will oversee and manage social and media agency relationships and be responsible for working with agency partners and Pure’ analytics suite to track and report on digital media performance. You will work closely with the global digital marketing team, theater program marketing, and field marketing to develop a digital media strategy that aligns with business goals and drives demand for the theatre. We are looking for a team member who has a proven track record of rolling up their sleeves to get the work done, thrives on analysis to refine how to optimise and has a global mindset. This role will pioneer new approaches and tactics by contributing to enterprise-wide digital strategies, and new approaches to brand storytelling.  This position is based in Singapore or Tokyo, Japan and will report to the Head of the Global Demand Centre. What You Will Be Doing WEB?  Collaborate with APJ programs and field marketing teams on the strategy and planning of APJ digital media programmes including paid search, programmatic media, and retargeting, paid & organic social, and content syndication. Work with appointed media and social agencies to lead the execution, reporting, and ongoing optimisation of these media programmes. Design and execute digital media plans that are aligned with the prospect and/or customer’s journey Work closely with colleagues in the Global Demand Center to define audience segmentation needs for the theatre, plan and execute targeted programs using data intelligence, track digital lead quality and provide feedback on BoM for digital activities. Work with agencies and internal analytics to set-up digital tracking needs and consolidate reporting to showcase digital media performance for the APJ theater. Work hands-on with the Pure Storage “marchitecture” in the region. Currently including (not limited to) SFDC, Tableau, Adobe Analytics & Marketo. Partner with key stakeholders, including APJ Leadership and field marketing managers, Digital Team, Product Marketing, Campaigns, Partner, Customer References and Corporate teams to ensure purestorage.com is optimised as a frictionless, localised and personalised experience to accelerate conversions and deliver measurable business results in APJ.
Requirements: RequirementsWhat You Bring To The Team  Proven work experience managing paid digital media and organic social media programmes in the B2B technology space and across APJ markets and an understanding of how to leverage paid, earned and owned media Experience with account-based marketing, and using data intelligence to deliver targeted activities to various audience segments Experience driving B2B demand generation in APJ markets. Experience with Japan market is a must. Demonstrated experience in successfully executing a social programme that includes growing followers organically, increasing engagements, and demand gen. conversions Strong project management skills with proven track record of delivering high-quality work under tight timelines Self-motivated and takes initiative; can work independently on multiple projects at once and has the ability to demonstrate sound decision-making and react quickly under pressure Demonstrated track record of leveraging data-driven research/analysis to drive strategic direction and website optimisation Solid knowledge of SEO and keyword research BS/BA degree required 8-10 years of digital and social media media experience and/or digital marketing strategy and execution management  Pure creates opportunities for your development and career growth. At Pure, we believe that each Puritan is a leader contributing to the success of our business, regardless of role. We offer an assortment of learning options available to all Puritans, including workshops on leadership, management, career development and more! We’re here to change the world and we hope you join us! Popular Perks Our rewards philosophy is tailored to provide Puritans globally competitive compensation and benefit programmes that enable innovation and growth. We offer a wide variety of benefits and perks including comprehensive medical insurance, meal service, opportunities to attend events, join sports leagues, employee assistance programme, work-life services, travel assistance, and employee resource groups – all of which are thoughtfully designed to maintain mind and body wellness. Through our Pure Good Foundation, we also offer numerous volunteer opportunities for employees to give back across the globe.

Title: Unskippable Labs Experimentation Lead - Singapore
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Global Clients & Agency Solutions Our Global Clients & Agency Solutions team helps serve some of the world's largest brands. Our dedicated teams of marketing and advertising specialists use their unique skill sets to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We aspire to advise our clients on all aspects of their online business strategy. Using Google's broad range of products, we help our clients connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. The role: Unskippable Labs Experimentation Lead - Singapore Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. Additional Role Description: Unskippable Labs' vision is to provide leading-edge guidance on vertically-driven ad campaign effectiveness through global scaled experimentation and analysis driven by machine learning and activated through flexible engagements with key Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS) and Large Customer Sales (LCS) clients to evolve their advertising on our platforms and beyond.  As the Unskippable Labs Experimentation Lead , you will help shape the Unskippable Lab’s Experimentation agenda for Asia-Pacific (APAC) and lead client engagements to educate them on our understanding of how ads and attention are evolving. You will apply knowledge from existing experimentation to our customers; creative assets, identify the right experiment opportunities, clearly defining the hypotheses, setting up the experiment, and distilling it down into actionable insights. You will also be responsible for managing the Unskippable team in APAC. In this role, you will work with the Advanced Brand Acceleration Ads Intelligence team to develop new templates and reporting dashboards that enable sellers to do their analyses of experiments. Responsibilities: - Consult on creative assets of opportunities with clients and their agencies. Present key creative and vertical narratives and identify experimentation opportunities against the areas outlined by the team. - Develop hypotheses for experimentation and lead the pitch with clients. Work with the creative strategist and agencies on the development of the test assets. - Lead the analysis and interpretation of results and insights across all experiments. Scale learnings internally with other APAC teams. - Lead recruitment of the Unskippable Army and manage regular trainings and connects. Work closely with the APAC Experiments team. - Connect regularly with the experimentation leads in other Unskippable Lab centres, share learnings, and share best practices for the APAC team. Liaise with the ABAT Ad Intelligence team to leverage scalable templates and tools.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - 3 years of experience in a video specialist and/or analytical role. - Experience with Google and YouTube media and measurement solutions products. Preferred qualifications: - Experience as a video specialist, analytical lead, or Account Strategist in LCS or Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS). - Experience as an account manager and video technologies. - Able to make recommendations for clients about how to best use Google/YouTube media and measurement products. - Ability to craft stories from data, frame hypotheses, and mine data and insights around creative effectiveness. Ability to craft presentations for clients. - Ability to identify opportunities comfortably speaking in front of executive audiences. - Interest about how ads work. Excellent business judgment, analytical, and presentation skills.

Title: Creative Strategist, Unskippable Labs - Singapore
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Global Clients & Agency Solutions Our Global Clients & Agency Solutions team helps serve some of the world's largest brands. Our dedicated teams of marketing and advertising specialists use their unique skill sets to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We aspire to advise our clients on all aspects of their online business strategy. Using Google's broad range of products, we help our clients connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. The role: Creative Strategist, Unskippable Labs - Singapore Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. Additional Role Description: Unskippable Labs vision: to provide leading-edge guidance on vertically-driven ad campaign effectiveness through global scaled experimentation and analysis driven by machine learning and activated through flexible engagements with key GCAS and LCS clients to evolve their advertising on our platforms and beyond.  This role will lead creative guidance as a part of the Unskippable Labs center team in partnership with insights and product/brand specialists. You will be the creative thought leader within your region, team and vertical. You will also diagnose opportunities for improving creative effectiveness in video and implement them in partnership with clients and agencies. Responsibilities: - Develop the core creative guidance for ad effectiveness across formats in partnership with media and product specialists. - Deliver that guidance in compelling and actionable ways to executive creative and brand clients. - Provide effective feedback on creative during development from idea to storyboard to edited assets. - Develop new hypotheses for creative experimentation and explore them via both client and unbranded experimentation. - Partner with regional service teams to ensure cohesive guidance on ad effectiveness recommendations.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - BA/BS degree in a related field, or equivalent practical experience. - 7 years of experience in creative strategy with demonstrated expertise in digital video. Preferred qualifications: - Experience working across brand verticals and geographies. - Ability to create effective ads, from initial idea through final edit. - Developed writing, pitch-crafting and presenting skills.
Address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981

Title: Abuse Analyst, Real Time Communications - Singapore
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Trust & Safety At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages. The role: Abuse Analyst, Real Time Communications - Singapore Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety. Additional Role Description: Our Trust & Safety team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users and ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products. The Trust and Safety Real Time Communications (RTC) team’s mission is to stop abusers from exploiting the gaps on our RTC products.   As an Abuse Analyst you will help us uncovering complex abuse issues, using machine learning and analytics and working closely with our engineering partners. You will understand the user's point of view and leverage big-picture thinking, strategic leadership, and technical skills to ensure their safety and meet their needs. In this role, you will work globally and cross-functionally with Product Managers and engineering partners to navigate challenging online safety situations and quickly handle abuse and fraud cases. Responsibilities: - Develop anti-abuse programs to solve for cross-product vulnerabilities and ensure successful global roll-outs. Design countermeasures for attacks across various client properties. - Analyze metrics, dig into underlying vulnerabilities, and design solutions. Represent the abuse team in cross-functional, cross-product area conversations with teams around the company, advising on counter-abuse strategies and coordinating integration efforts. - Develop and deploy machine learning models collaborating with Engineering partners to solve fraud/abuse problems at scale. - Define workflow processes for manual reviews and machine learning labels. Collaborate with Product, Design, Legal, Policy, and Industry partners to advance the state-of-the-art across the Internet as a whole. - Align cross-functional teams toward a common, measurable goal.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related technical field. - Experience deriving abuse signals and conclusions from data. - Experience summarizing data. - Experience facilitating automation and prevention processes. Preferred qualifications: - Experience in a technical role (e.g., Data Scientist, Quantitative Analyst, Technical Program Manager, Engineer). - Experience developing machine learning models. Experience in one or more programming language (e.g., Python, Java, C++). - Experience in statistics, working with statistical packages (e.g., R, SAS, Matlab) and large datasets (SQL). - Experience delivering projects that involve multiple cross-functional stakeholders across geographies. - Experience with fraud/abuse investigations, fraud/risk management, and security and threat analysis in the context of Internet-related products/activities. - Ability to work remotely and maintain excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Title: 2019 Full Time Campus Analyst - Engineering Division
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world. ABOUT ENGINEERING Our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible.  Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas.  Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients.  Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action.  Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. ROLES Software Engineering Transform our business and work across all areas of the firm to design and implement high-quality, scalable and smart solutions. Leveraging both internal and open source services, we design and develop applications capable of building, maintaining, and processing large & complex data sets. Ensuring we have the most up-to-date and actionable information, we constantly strive to boost performance and exceed industry standards in order to meet our clients’ evolving needs. We look for ways to improve our operations and enhance our client offerings through internal and external platforms as we build and expand the capacity for data mining, anomaly detection, and business intelligence. Financial Modelling We look beyond the numbers and find the trends. As a member of our team, you will extract meaningful information to engineer advice and solutions that have real-world implications for our clients and the firm.  This level of expert analysis involves large, at times global, data sets – both structured and unstructured – to build predictive models that are relevant to specific business centers and account for market variables. These quantitative techniques then inform effective and accurate cross-asset trade and portfolio ideas for our clients. In collaboration with your team and others across the firm, you will build and enhance advanced quantitative and analytical methods, utilizing software to design risk modeling systems and develop machine learning algorithms. Specifically, your role will focus on providing APIs to clients helping them generate alpha, risk calculations and business metrics. This valuable information will allow them to build and challenge risk models that identify and quantify market and liquidity risk and modeling vulnerabilities. Infrastructure Engineering Infrastructure Engineering is a multi-faceted role that allows you to explore data center design, networks, storage, cloud computing, big data, application messaging, databases, communications, market data and software languages. Make things possible for our clients and the firm as you design and build our compute and data infrastructure. You will put your expertise to work in a variety of challenges, from identifying internal hardware needs, to implementing public and private cloud-based solutions to providing seamless, on-demand scaling of our applications.  We provide a robust testing platform that involves the best standards, solutions and tools to ensure uninterrupted operation of all of our lines of business. You will have the opportunity to use data mining techniques to identify and react to problems in the firm’s infrastructure and platforms. A role on this team allows you to use your experience to help us transform the future at Goldman Sachs.

Title: IT Support Specialist
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur team is seeking talented, motivated and dedicated individual for the role of Helpdesk Consultant for multiple projects. If you’re naturally a helper, enjoy assisting people with software or hardware issues whether the problem relates to a user error, a bug or something else entirely and are able to explain technical details simply. If this sounds like a good fit, we’d like to meet you.Mentioned below are the roles & responsibilities and desired skill set: The Company Bambu is a Fintech start-up which specialises in providing Robo-Advisory solutions for banks, insurance companies and non-financial industries like Telcos & E-Commerce. Leveraging on deep learning technologies, we believe that we can change the way people save, invest and manage their wealth. We are a fast-growing start-up based in Singapore and Hong Kong. Founded in 2016, we have raised funding from the likes of Franklin Templeton and Wavemaker, achieved a global network of prospects and established clients like Standard Chartered and Thomson Reuters. We launched Singapore’s first Robo-Advisory platform for Crossbridge Capital, a global wealth management firm and aiming to get new prospective clients on board. Roles & Responsibilities  Focused.Someone who’s keen in finding out solutions to every problem rather than presenting problem to every solution. Accountable.Takes full ownership and won’t be able to sleep at night until issues are resolved by thorough diagnostic of any hardware or software faults and take accountabilityof customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution. Detail oriented.Ensure all issues are properly logged, prioritize and manage several open issues at one time with agreed time limits.From the moment a ticket is submitted, this person knows how to ask the right questions and gather the available data to narrow down the root cause of the issue. Like Sherlock Holmes, they leave no stone unturned in figuring out what’s really going on. Quality over quantity.When you have a long list of tickets, and know there are more coming in, it’s tempting to work on as many as possible, without truly solving the problem at hand. Focusing on the quality of the support you give, as opposed to the quantity of tickets you touch, will ensure you’re actually solving problems and creating happy customers. Process driven.Following standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams (e.g. software developers). This person understands support processes are important, and not only follows them, but helps improve them.  Consistent.Follow up with clients to ensure their systems are fully functional after troubleshooting. Excellent communication skills.Communicate with clients through a series of actions, either via phone, email or chat, until they’ve solved a technical issue. Team player.Optimistic and works well with colleagues with a collaborative team spirit. This person enjoys themselves at work, spreading a positive can-do attitude. A great support agent integrates a bit of fun into their daily tasks to make everyone’s loads a little lighter. Customer centric.Works with the customer and not for the customer, helps build strong customer relationship for long-term business. Tech Savvy.Sound knowledge in cloud environment, API integration and SQL. Must have the urge to learn and adopt to fast pace environment.

Title: GIS - Research Officer (Computational Phenomics Platform)
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS) is an institute of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR). It has a global vision that seeks to use genomic sciences to improve public health and public prosperity. Established in 2001 as a centre for genomic discovery, the GIS will pursue the integration of technology, genetics and biology towards the goal of individualized medicine.     We are looking for motivated candidate who will be developing/maintaining relational databases and web portal hosting high-throughput screening data from across A*STAR, NUS, NUH and industry users. The individual will conduct analysis conforming to the ISO standard procedures established in the platform and develop customised analyses for academic as well as industry users. He/she will assist in the development of machine learning models for predicting drug response from various types of cellular models, image segmentation and analysis of cellular microscopy images as well as development of new platform technologies through research collaborations with academic and industry partners.

Title: AI Infrastructure Engineer for 100E (AISG)

You are a person who strives to improve their knowledge of infrastructure, systems and automation continually.   Entry-level graduates are welcome to apply for a Junior position for this role provided that they show some experience contributing in an infrastructure-related Open Source project for at least a year or similar.   Those with technical leadership experience are welcome to apply for a Senior position for this role.   In this role, you will:  Build and maintain production infrastructure to be resilient, secure and high performance. Mentor AISG Apprentices and others from a software engineering or infrastructure capacity.

Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for a highly motivated and talented individual with passion in oncology and genomics laboratory research to join the Translational Radiation Oncology (TRO) Research Programme. You will primarily work with the Principal Investigator (PI) and the current research and clinical teams comprising two radiation oncologists, two research fellows, two clinical research coordinators and four research officers. Be involved in inter-departmental collaborations with oncologists, pathologists, scientists as well as local and international collaborators.

Research experience in a genomics, oncology, molecular/cellular biology or immunology laboratory.  Knowledge and experience in genomics analyses (e.g. analyses of WES, RNASeq data) and biostatistical analyses of clinical datasets would be advantageous. Highly motivated, organised, meticulous and committed to high quality standards. Strong organisational, interpersonal and presentation skills. Analytical and self-confident with a mature personality. Responsible and passionate about radiomics, genomics and oncology research. A team player with a collaborative mindset who is able to prioritise and multi-task.   We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Enforcement Detection Analyst, Trust and Safety, YouTube - Singapor
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: YouTube At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. The role: Enforcement Detection Analyst, Trust and Safety, YouTube - Singapore Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world. Additional Role Description: As an Enforcement Detection Analyst, you will be responsible for identifying and removing disruptive content as quickly as possible. You will use advanced modeling and analytical techniques on hundreds of features against a massive corpus and hundreds of hours of new content being uploaded every minute.  Responsibilities: - Develop and implement strategies and models and heuristic rules to enforce YouTube content policies at scale across hundreds of millions of videos/comments. Leverage Machine Learning, as appropriate. - Deliver improvements to our performance metrics based on deep understanding of drivers of operations. Leverage deep programming skills to ensure that solutions fit within the current complex product and backend infrastructures. - Work closely with the Policy and Operations teams to understand the evolving policy enforcement landscape, and with Engineering teams to develop and test new features that address operational needs. - Provide rapid incident response for abuse problems, operating independently. Analyze and draw conclusions on root-causes and define and implement mitigation steps.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - MS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience. - 2 years of work experience in a relevant field. - Experience with machine learning, programming, database querying (SQL) and statistics. - Experience with creating metrics to measure performance of models, building dashboards and reporting. Preferred qualifications: - Exceptional problem-solving and analytical abilities with a proven history of going above and beyond to make operational improvements and solve tough problems. - Experience or demonstrated interest in content policy and/or anti-abuse operations at scale. - Experience with machine learning tools, techniques, and systems. - Experience with abuse fighting at scale in similar product domains. - Demonstrated ability in working with a variety of stakeholders to gather requirements, explaining models, and iterating to make improvements. - Strong written and spoken communication skills.
Address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981

Title: Junior Computer Vision Engineer for Deep learning applied to Real World Robotic System
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesIntroduction TUMCREATE is a leading Research Institute set up by the Technical University of Munich, Germany in collaboration with the Singapore Government. TUMCREATE has received funding and support for the SPEEDCARGO project from the Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) & the national Research Foundation (NRF) to develop automation solutions that will transform the Air Freight Logistics sector. The SPEEDCARGO solution will be the world's first AI-powered robotic solution for automatic build-up and break down of aviation cargo pallets and will help Singapore lead the transformation of the Logistics industry globally. The project is seeking technical experts with a passion for creating world class products, and a willingness to work in a fast paced, quality obsessed, multi-cultural global environment. On successful completion, the project will be spun off as a start-up with members of the project team having the option to join the start-up with benefits that include attractive ESOPs. Apply now if you are interested in working on cutting edge technologies, changing the world with your work and joining a dynamic start-up team. More details on the project: https://www.speedcargo.sg/   Background The design of real-world robotic systems is a multi-disciplinary effort. It involves the development of advanced perception systems, artificial intelligence based decision making, mechanical elements like sensors and actuators, electronic components for connecting and controlling the mechanical elements and software for higher-level planning and process control. This job profile focuses on development of specific computer vision modules for the perception system within SPEEDCARGO. It will involve the following specific task which the successful candidate will have to execute towards a real world working application.  Photo realistic texture generation and mapping for synthesizing geometry and appearance of airfreight shipments. This data will be used for training a deep neural network Implementing a C++ pipeline for a deep edge neural network trained on the data set specific in point 1 Integrating, testing a deploying the module within CargoEye Algorithm for generating synthetic data of closely packed boxes on a airfreight ULD pallet adhering to airline regulations. Using this dataset to do deep edge learning using the framework specified in point 2 Design, modelling and implementation of a 3D calibration framework for 3D camera sets using a non-planer and precision engineered cubic pattern  What we offer you  An international and multidisciplinary working environment Opportunity to work on deep-tech robotic system Challenging tasks with real-life relevance
Requirements: RequirementsMandatory Requirements  Since the project will focus on real world deployment of industrial robotics system we require the candidate to have hands on experience working on computer vision for real world systems (preferable in Industry). PhD/Master/Bachelor Degree from a reputed university Strong fundamentals in computer science and mathematics related to Computer Vision. Past internships/working experience in reputed universities and robotics research labs is essential  What we expect from you  Relevant experience in deep learning frameworks (tensor flow and cafe) and applied to practical and real world system Statistical analysis, State Estimation (Kalman Filters, Particle Filters) and Machine Learning (SVM, Decision Trees, Neural Networks). Experience with pallalel computing like CUDA etc Experience working in a software development team with best practice methods implemented Familiarity with ROS, C/C++, Java, Python, Linux, git, OpenCV, PCL, OpenGL, MATLAB GUI and Mobile App Development Ability to work independently

Title: Research Fellow
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA Research Fellow position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research. To support teaching and cutting-edge research, EEE is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories, which are well-equipped with modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment. With about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,300 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world. Job Description To treat neurological patients, an in-depth analysis and understanding of patient-specific EEG is required and critical. However, visual inspection of EEG recordings is prohibitively time-consuming, and most hospitals do not have the personnel for this task. Automated algorithms to inspect EEG will allow us to analyse much larger volumes of EEG signals, in turn allowing us to build up a detailed database of waveforms associated with epilepsy and other neurological disorders. It has potential application in real-time seizure detection, non-expert EEG evaluation, and improved understanding of neurological disorders. We will develop deep learning methods for analysing EEG signals, which is an entirely new approach with much potential. Deep learning methods have consistently outperformed standard methods for speech and image analysis, and are expected to outshine existing methodologies also for biomedical signals and EEG in particular. In this project, we have the following aims: Aim1: To apply existing deep learning algorithms (CNN and LSTM recurrent networks) for the specific application of recognizing patterns in time series, and identify strengths and weaknesses of the existing algorithms. Aim2: To develop novel deep learning algorithms based on Bayesian variational inference and other approaches, for the specific application of recognizing patterns in time series. Aim3:  To apply these deep learning algorithms for reliable EEG-based BCI classification and automatic detection of epileptic seizures from pediatric EEG (Physionet dataset). The Research Fellow will assist in conducting this research, writing journal publications, and preparing grant applications.
Requirements: Requirements PhD degree in electrical engineering, computer science, or statistics Minimum 2 years of relevant experience Required skills include signal processing, machine learning, EEG analysis, programming in Matlab, Python, C++, or C  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
