Title: Associate Incentives Accounting
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSabre is a technology solutions provider to the global travel and tourism industry. It offers a broad range of technology solutions including data-driven business intelligence, mobile, distribution and Software-as-a-Service solutions which are used by travel suppliers (airlines, hotels, car rental outlets, railways, cruise lines and tour operators) and travel buyers (travel agencies, travel management companies and corporate travel departments) to plan, market, sell, serve and operate their business. In 2013, Sabre’s technology processed over $100 billion of estimated travel spending and more than 1.1 trillion system messages. Headquartered in Southlake, Texas, USA, Sabre employs approximately 10,000 people in approximately 60 countries around the world. We serve our customers through cutting-edge technology developed in six facilities located across four continents. The company operates three brands/businesses: Sabre Airline Solutions, Sabre Hospitality Solutions, and Sabre Travel Network.  Under direct supervision, responsible for developing, implementing and/or maintaining one or a combination of general accounting systems. Prepares journal entries, maintains and reconciles ledger accounts. Provides record of assets, liabilities and other financial transactions. Balances books periodically and prepares profit and loss, income and balance sheet statements. Maintains receipts and disbursement reports. May prepare federal, state, and local reports and tax returns. May interpret reports and records for managers. Assist with analysis of non-complex ledger accounts and resolve issues. Post entries to general ledger and assist with month end close process. Prepare account reconciliation. Assist with special projects as needed.
Requirements: RequirementsEDUCATION:  Bachelor's degree in Accounting will be a plus.  Good Communication skills.

Title: Technology Risk Associate (FAIT), Advisory, Singapore
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur Technology Risk services are designed for the dual purpose of strengthening internal controls and, in so doing, helping to improve IT and business performance. In addition to assurance-related engagements such as financial attestation and ISAE 3402 engagements, our IT risk advisory services focus on IT governance and effectiveness; IT program management and assurance; security and controls of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) implementations; and business intelligence and information analysis.   The opportunity You will develop skills that you will value for your entire career. You will also work with tomorrow’s business leaders and gain hands on best practice experience.   Your key responsibilities As a Senior Associate within the Technology Risk team, you will participate in and supervise multiple client engagement teams and other related activities. Engagements focus on the assessment and/or evaluation of Information Technology (IT) systems and the mitigation of IT-related business risks. Engagements may be either assurance (attestation) and/or risk advisory in nature, and vary considerably in size and complexity. You will serve as a fieldwork leader to assist clients in employing proper information systems, resources, and controls to maximize efficiencies and minimize risk. You will work with client personnel to analyze, evaluate, and enhance information systems facilitating the business internal control process, and will assist clients and other Technology Risk professionals in performing information technology control and security engagements. Skills and attributes for success   Collaborate with other members of the engagement team to plan the engagement and develop work program timelines, risk assessments, and other planning documents.   Work with the engagement team to document the business processes dependent on information technology   Serve as a fieldwork leader by directing the daily progress of fieldwork, informing supervisors of engagement status, and managing staff performance   Demonstrate and apply a thorough understanding of complex information systems   Use knowledge of the current IT environment and industry IT trends to identify the engagement and client service issues, and communicate this information to the engagement team and client management through written correspondence and verbal presentations   Demonstrate and apply strong project management skills, inspire teamwork and responsibility with engagement team members, and use current technology and tools to enhance the effectiveness of deliverables and services   Manage a portfolio of assignments as project lead
Requirements: RequirementsTo qualify for the role you must have  A recognized university degree in accounting, business, information technology, or other relevant discipline with 1 year of working experience Willingness to travel on overseas assignment as the need arises Significant experience in applying relevant technical knowledge in at least one of the following engagements: (a) financial statement audits; (b) internal or operational audits; (c) ISAE 3402 Attest engagements; and/or (d) ERP security and control reviews (Oracle, SAP, PeopleSoft) (e) SOX integrated audit  Project management skills Strong written and verbal communication skills and presentation skills Leadership, teamwork and client service skills Demonstrated integrity within a professional environment  Ideally, you will also have  CPA, CA, CISA, CISSP, CISM, CBCP, CIA, CIPP, CGEIT certification     What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What working at EY offers  EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world.   Apply now.

Title: Business and Operations Manager, Google Cloud - Singapore
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Google Cloud Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. The role: Business and Operations Manager, Google Cloud - Singapore Google Cloud teams work with schools, companies, and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You help fellow sales Googlers by performing budgeting, planning, and analysis activities — and through your passion for the magic of Google products like G Suite and Chrome. Not only do you provide invaluable financial and budgeting input, but you also devise new ways for us to communicate with potential leads and bring them into the Google fold. Your insight means you excel at customer segmentation, acquisition, and retention. You combine clean communication with strong analytical skills and a solid commitment to providing customers with a Googley customer experience. You also peer into the future for us; you examine and analyze statistical data to forecast marketing trends and to identify potential new markets for Google Cloud. Additional Role Description: The Google Cloud Customer team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global data center and software assets. As a Business and Operations Manager, you will partner with Sales leadership to provide actionable insights and use a data driven approach to sharpen decision-making and drive deep understanding of our fast growing business. Combined with the resources of a dedicated sales force, our insights translate directly to accelerated growth and improve Google’s ability to serve its Cloud customers at scale. In this role, you will help drive and develop the performance and strategy our Japan and Asia-Pacific (JAPAC) Cloud business, ensuring rapid and long term sustainable growth for our Cloud offering. Responsibilities: - Provide thoughtful leadership and influence executive level decision making through deep analytical insight and core business decisions. - Structure and communicate complex, ambiguous, and potentially challenging business issues to advise the Google Cloud Customer Japan and Asia-Pacific (JAPAC) Leadership team. - Build a network across Sales, Operations, Business Intelligence, and Finance, in JAPAC and across the globe, to address a wide analytical and operational questions. - Shape the vision and trajectory for the JAPAC business, partnering with leadership to run regular business reviews and keep the business on track with both our short-term and long-term goals. Delivering strategic insights and targeted action plans to address specific areas of risk and opportunity, leveraging the support of Global teams. - Enable regional teams with at-scale insights, analyses, and common processes and tools. Support and communicate effectively with English speaking clients.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - 5 years of experience in strategic planning, consulting, investment banking, or similar role. - Experience with SQL and other database, scripting, or business intelligence tools. Preferred qualifications: - MBA or other relevant Master's degree. - Ability to construct simple and impactful messages from complex analyses. Ability to influence business leadership. - Ability to take initiative and work in an unstructured environment. Ability to navigate ambiguity, providing clarity and structure. - Ability to create and grow effective cross-functional networks and manage without authority. - Excellent business judgment, analytical, and written and verbal communication skills. - Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

Title: Recruitment Consultant
Responsibilities: Roles & Responsibilities    Recruitment Consultant - Job Overview   Job Overview:   The Recruitment Consultant will work in between the Sales Team and candidates.  They will work in partnership with the Sales team taking control of managing the recruitment process from candidate generation through to candidate placement.  Recruitment Consultants will work within a vertical market specialization having direct touch points to a network of mid, senior candidates and niche junior level candidates, SearchElect’s internal team members and client contact. They will develop a deep understanding of the various research tools to come up with a ‘Talent Map’ of the market and own candidate control through the entire recruitment process.  In addition to working on various recruitment processes, the Recruitment Consultant will also be at the forefront of market activity. Therefore an important source of business intelligence to feed back into the SearchElect organization and adding value to ensure that the organization remains competitive with a leading edge and capitalizes on market trends and opportunities. Activities: Overview   Research Stage: Create search criteria from qualified job forms in order to execute a candidate search and if necessary, collaborate  with the Business Support and refine searches to improve results.   Marketing Stage: Share market knowledge and inform the marketing team with the latest trending topics relevant to the technology industry in order to create brand awareness to target business customers and candidate registrations.   Align marketing activities and efforts towards recruiting and sales objectives. Feed back any ROI to marketing.   Creation of Talent Pools: Organise candidate CRM and social media  lists and tagging methods of active and passive  candidates within the target area’s of the SearchElect specialist markets.  Collaborate with business support to provide search criteria for ‘watchdogs’.   Intelligence gathering: Generate market intelligence from Candidates. Upload references as Contacts to the Applicant Tracking System. Generate information from potential Clients and Candidates via reference checks for active Candidates. Meet active candidates to learn market intelligence and gain potential leads as well as referrals of new candidates. Increased interaction with our internal database.   Recruiting - Submission’s: Standardise job forms for external advertising. Execute candidate search process against planned path depending on urgency and job scoring criteria. Qualify shortlist of Candidates using SearchElect policy and procedures around red flags, risks, ABC techniques. Collaborate  with the sales team from strategy to follow-up’s pending from the client. Prepare candidates for sendouts.    Recruiting -  Sendouts: Use talent pools and hiring manager distribution lists to cross market ‘hot candidates’ to target hiring managers.  Sendout shortlist of candidates to hiring managers or HR.   Recruiting - Interviewing: Control entire interview process from the hiring manager request, coordination, candidate and where possible hiring manager preparations, feedback exchanges using the ATS process and policy. Collaborate with sales accordingly. Ensure that Sales team is equipped with all possible red flags and concerns from a candidate perspective to prepare and inform client and eliminate challenges on closing as early as the interviewing stage. Meet and prepare the candidate by stimulating in them the right mindset when they have the interview.   Recruiting - Placement’s: Pre-close the Candidate using the ABC method from first contact. Follow the SearchElect process and policies throughout the lifecycle of the search processes from first contact to offer and counter offer discussions. Ensure proper adherence to the SearchElect red flag procedures to maximise successful placements and reduce the risk of ‘drop offs’.   Recruiting - Post-placement: Follow the SearchElect post placement process and periodically meet with placed candidates for after service and account support activities.   Recruitment - Account Support: Identify potential opportunities within the Company/Client for current or future purposes. Put this down as task or job lead for the sales team to follow through.   Experience required:     People-oriented mindset - able to understand and appreciate other perspectives   Realistic thinker and able to overcome objectives pragmatically   Understands the difference between IQ/EQ and able to identify the differences between these and how to work with the different balances individually and with other people   Identifying ‘redflags’ and business risks.   Online data mining – Social Media, websites etc.   Building and structuring internal CRM and systems   Working with customers in B2B within a professional capacity   Experience relating to recruitment or talent acquisition in an agency or in house environment   Good written English to update records   Strong communication skills to speak with internal and external people.     Skills required:     Interviewing   Market research – Business directory search and build   Deep Social Media – Linkedin, Facebook , Twitter, Blog etc.   Data research – based on clients   Organization   Fluency in English both written and spoken   Data organization   Business Intelligence gathering   Spreadsheets     Personal attributes:   Communicative (able to build rapport)   Influential   Problem solver

Responsibility: • Represent Oracle professionally on client sites. • Work with customer representatives, both technical and non-technical, to produce a solution that fulfils their requirements • Develop and maintain an up to date knowledge of relevant Oracle products and services within the rapidly evolving PaaS offerings, especially within Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence area • Support, and where necessary, drive technology adoption by clients, including positioning Oracle Consulting’s Data Warehouse services • Own project delivery as technical expert/leader to the customers when implementing solutions and developments • Develop solutions that follow product development guidelines and are in line with established build and design standards • Deliver innovative Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence solutions using Oracle’s PaaS offerings • Transfer product knowledge to customers to reinforce training or in lieu of training • Resolve or escalate client issues as appropriate to support and engineering team. • Collaborate by sharing knowledge and best practice within the practice and across lines of business • Participate in project planning along with the Domain Lead, Programme owners, and project managers • Develop peer network through which to provide and receive product and skills assistance
Requirements: Requirements• Applicants should have significant Oracle Data Warehouse experience, ideally with integration to/from Oracle Applications • Able to perform complex problem solving and should be comfortable working according to company policies and processes • Knowledge and experience of Oracle’s PaaS Applications, primarily in Oracle Integration solution area • Knowledge and experience of Cloud Integration strategies and implementations • Having a good understanding of ETL/ELT tools implementation • Ability to develop function and program in PL/SQL and/or standard SQL programming • Good understanding and exposure to the following, in no particular order: • Oracle Database • Oracle Data Integrator • Oracle SQL Developer • Data Warehouse Concept and Implementation • Business Intelligence Concept and Implementation • Experience in working as part of an external/internal virtual team or alone as required by priorities • The ability to work in a collaborative and energetic environment with other technology and business disciplines  Additional Skills: • Good presentation and having an effective communication skill • Experience in data design and data modeling will be an advantage • Good business analysis and strong technical technology skills

Title: Systems Engineer
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany Description As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce. At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers. You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays. Job Description POSITION SUMMARY The Middleware Engineering team is part of the Global Service Engineering and is responsible for common middleware and integration infrastructure that supports communication between multiple enterprise applications and multiple business lines.  This role will be responsible for design, development, configuration, problem analysis, deployment, and continuous operational improvement of middleware technologies used at Visa.  The responsibility includes working with Global systems, Global Operations, Cybersource and external Integration partners in implementing  solutions via current or proposed middleware technologies, including but not limited to Application Servers(WebLogic, WebSphere, tcServer, JBOSS, etc.), Web Servers, Oracle SOA, Oracle BPM, Oracle Business Intelligence, Oracle Identity Management and Java/J2EE applications. Understanding of Actuate reporting, SOA, Data power, LDAP and DB2 database will be a plus.  He or she must be able to collaborate with others to manage and rationalize incoming requirements in order to implement appropriate solutions.  Key Responsibilities We are looking for Systems Analysts to join our Operations & Infrastructure team. Candidate should be able to:  Gather and analyze requirements from development teams to design, deploy and support of various enterprise middleware technologies. Provide technology leadership in tcServer, Tomcat, IBM WebSphere Application Server, Oracle WebLogic, messaging solution (message broker, MQ) Architect, integrate and configure applications to fully utilize the above technologies as well as Datapower, LDAP, Siteminder and other Middleware technologies. Provide level 3 (engineering) production support for integration solutions in production environments Lead problem resolution and improvement efforts Drive constant interaction with developers, architects, and project managers. Enhance Middleware and Integration operating procedures and engineering patterns. Provide input to project planning, estimation, budget, resource, and technology planning.
Requirements: RequirementsQualifications  BS or MS in Computer Science or related degree from an accredited university Basic level of experience on Application servers like Tomcat, IBM WebSphere, Weblogic, etc. Basic level of experience on Web. Server like IIS, IBM IHS, etc. Basic experience with a scripting language (Shell script, Perl, Python, bash) Experience in troubleshooting production issues and problem solving. Exceptional oral and written communication skills Basic level of knowledge on Windows/UNIX/Linux OS. Experience with CA SiteMinder, CA Web Agent Integration with web server, CA Identity Manager, CA Directory Server, Red Hat Directory Server and Oracle Directory Server products Experience programming in Java, J2EE Experience with Fraud Management, Payment and/or Credit Card processing is a plus XML parsing and XML schema design experience

Company: NIKE GLOBAL TRADING B.V. SINGAPORE BRANCH
Title: Integrated Knowledge Manager
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Nike Direct Digital Commerce (NDDC) Asia Hub   Launch in 2015, NDDC Asia Hub directly serves to bring inspiration and innovation to every Athlete* by enabling consumers to purchase Nike footwear, apparel and equipment through Nike.com and swiftly delivered.    As a premium direct to consumer distribution channel for Nike Inc, the digital commerce team is responsible for achieving traffic, conversion and sales targets and operates across key functions to ensure consumers in the 7 countries in South East Asia, India, and Taiwan are served with the best of Nike products and consumer experience.   RESPONSIBILITIES As the leader of the Integrated Knowledge team, this position will oversee the team providing strategic analysis of business intelligence and digital analytics of the NDDC Asia Hub business in these distinct areas:   1.    Regular Business Evaluation a)    Create, collect and deliver weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual business KPIs by orchestrating inputs across all relevant functions.   b)    Own and deliver weekly business internal touchpoints as well as resulting executive business performance read-outs.     2.    Deliver Strategic Business Insights a)    Establish operating framework and define a roadmap of insights delivery against existing time and resources.   b)    Prioritize completion of research projects against the growth needs of the business and sizing inefficiencies on data-driven operations across functions.   c)    Deliver insights against the functional pillars of:  Experience, Performance/Strategy, Merchandise, Buyer/Members and Marketing.   Direct responsibilities include:   •    Team Leadership:  Setting individual and functional objectives to define the future growth of this team. Develop individual and team capabilities with a focus on developing best in class talent, process, and systems that continually overachieve expectations.   •    Forecasting/Budgeting:  Work as a central point of contact to define monthly business forecasts as a cross-functional liaison.  Maintain inputs, achieve buy-in and communicate approved forecasts and budgets.   •    Internal Systems and Tools liaison  Act as the central liason and driver of the NDDC Asia Hub data across key internal and global partners in Global Consumer Knowledge and data engineering teams.
Requirements: RequirementsAs functional leader and people manager of this key analytical function within the NDDC Asia Hub team, we are seeking a strong team player with deep experience in statistical business and data analytics in a direct-to-consumer oriented business.   We are seeking a highly analytical individual with proven success in driving data driven insights within large organizations.  The ability to manage inputs from many teams and individuals that span multiple functions and lines of reporting are crucial for the success. At the end of the day, you are passionate about the consumer and ensuring that the expectations of the NDDC business are continually managed and exceeded.     Required qualifications include:   •    Completion of a College of University Bachelors degree.   •    5-7 years’ experience with data analysis and web analytics tools in a digital commerce or digital retail business. •    Experience building high performing teams with a web analytics function or team.   •    Experience with Adobe Analytics, Tableau and other enterprise business intelligence tools and databased.   •    Proven ability to handle ambiguity in a fast-paced, constantly evolving work environment. •    Strong presentation skills, and excellent written and verbal communication skills to a wide range of audiences including senior level corporate executives.   •    Knowledge and command of database programming languages such as SQL.     Preferred qualifications include:   •    Proven ability to lead organizational change and deliver complex projects within an organization •    Advanced degree in mathematics or statistics.   •    Deep knowledge of Nike footwear and apparel. •    Familiarity with or experience in engineering database frameworks or infrastructure.

Title: Manager, International Marketplace
Responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a leader on the International Marketplace team, you’ll have a unique opportunity to drive GO-JEK’s international expansion.. Working across Southeast Asia, you’ll be responsible for setting up the fundamentals of the business in new expansion markets working with the local teams. Collaborating across diverse stakeholders, it is essential that you command strong communication skills. Leveraging business intelligence data, market insights, and your creativity, you will grow a healthy business managing our product offering, pricing, driver incentives, among others.. Working closely with our technical groups, data analysts, and business teams, you will be a key player in the success story of GO-JEK’s international expansion. With any high-growth business, this will be a fast-paced and dynamic environment.  Complex Problem Solving - Leveraging world-class data systems, you will analyze various initiatives to inform key business decisions. This will include supply & demand balancing efforts, customer segmentation decisions, feature prioritisation, and much more. Strategy Shaping - Build, maintain, and communicate a detailed strategy for the international business. International Launcher - Get in the details of what each country needs to hit their targets. You will work closely with the local teams to understand the nuanced needs of Bangkok, Ho Chi Minh City, and Singapore among others. Be the bridge to connect local nuances to HQ product team. Champion of Best-Practice - Design and lead end-to-end experimentations, document and share best practices from your various learnings. Documentation is how we get smarter, better, and faster. Build Strong Relationships -  Engage and empathise with country teams. You will not be successful without building trust with your stakeholders. . Regional Coverage & Communication - Covering Southeast Asia will require strong digital communication (think emails, Whatsapp, web conferencing) and occasional travel.
Requirements: Requirements “Can-Do” Attitude: A positive attitude and passion for learning in fast-paced environments. We move fast! Fast & Agile: Ability to excel in a constantly changing and rapidly growing workplace. Communication: Strong communication skills. You know how to build trust, set goals, and get things done. You aren’t afraid of using whatever channel (face-to-face, email, Whatsapp) is required. Data-Driven Outlook: When making decisions you leverage technical resources and data to support hypotheses. You can take the basics of data and draw insights from it. Life without Excel terrifies you. SQL, R, Python experience is a plus. Language:   	 Fluency in business-level English is a must. Bahasa, Vietnamese, Thai, or Mandarin/Cantonese would be a bonus.   Required Experience:   You’ve got prior learnings using data to make decisions, you have a proven track record of building systems and scaling them,  you have managed diverse stakeholders with ease. You are an expert in Microsoft Office & Google-Suite products. You have at least a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field. You have 2 years in a professional role in a relevant field.
